alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 8:39PM CDT until May 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Walsh, Marshall, Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Grand Forks, Polk, Marshall and Walsh Counties. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Flooding on road cut at old meander scar east of gage begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
